alert.note: Alert for Coastal Waldo; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 2:51PM EST until December 18 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...PROLONGED WINTER STORM EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure across the Mid Atlantic will move north and east into southern New England tonight and on Friday...with the season`s first widespread winter storm expected to continue across the area through Saturday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Wet Snow expected. Total snow of 2 to 7 inches with the greatest amounts furthest from the coast. * WHERE...Coastal Waldo, Knox, Lincoln, and Sagadahoc Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM Friday to Midnight EST Saturday Night. * IMPACTS...Heavy wet snow will cause weighted tree limbs of conifers and leafed trees, leading to snapped branches. Isolated to scattered outages possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will mix with and possibly change to rain for a time Friday before changing to all snow late Friday and Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
